stories.text:
In the making of a new language, i was wondering, what testing strategies are out there? Which one(s) is/are the best? And why?

Follow up, What is it exactly that causes us to need tests? To me, it sounds like, the compiler just cannot understand all code. E.g. when writing data to a pointer, the compiler does not know how much space is allocated for that pointer. Is it possible to make the compiler understand, or is that crazy work?
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the best testing strategy?

stories.text:
[TOMT] [BLOG] A blog - news/article aggregator by an expert in his/her name that covers political news and policy changes around the globe.

A news/article aggregator by an expert in his/her name that covers political news and policy changes around the globe.

More details:

- It provides an RSS feed.

- The feed gets updated for every new story/article featured as a hyperlink.

- The blog is more of aggregating various news than having original write-ups.

Originally posted at Reddit but didn't got the answer : https://www.reddit.com/r/tipofmytongue/comments/th01ko/tomt_blog_a_blog_newsarticle_aggregator_by_an/
